website_summaries.verdict: A flavorless powder that goes well with juice or a shake.
pros: At 114 servings, this container is a better value by the ounce than many competitors
Contains 5 grams of creatine monohydrate per serving

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness for my Doctor!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this bottle along to my annual physical and I told my Doc (who’s also a fitness enthusiast) that I started taking this stuff for working out and he immediately told me to throw this away. He said synthetic creatine may contribute to kidney damage. Creatine is naturally produced by the body and you really don’t need any more. I would say to talk to your physician (or two) before taking this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Successishere

customer_reviews.title: How to dissolve quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Creatine is a fantastic supplement, even if you are not a body builder. Btw, Creatine has a half-life of 6-8 weeks in the body. Some users might have digestive issues if it is not dissolved. Any easy way to resolve this is to put about 4 oz of hot water in your cup or blender bottle and then add the creatine. Stir for a couple minutes and it should be completely or sufficiently dissolved. Add some cold water (I add Spring Water with a couple ice cubes). I then add my Whey Protein Powder and shake my blender bottle. Adding the hot water may be a slight inconvience but is worth it. Think of it as "pre-digestion".
customer_reviews.author: Tony D

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bad bottle
customer_reviews.text: I think by now everyone knows about all the wonderful effects of creatine. It is one of the most studied and effective ergogenic supplement out there. This uses the highly rated creapure creatine. Knocking off a star for not having a scooper and having a terrible bottle design. As you consume more of the product you have to pour all of the product to the top of the container in order to get a scoop of it because the cap is too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely works. More so with endurance. I would encourage you to do the loading stage for like the first week and work out with it. I noticed a difference within a week and I only do push ups everyday. Muscles are harder and I'm able to do more effortlessly from when I first started. Must buy can't go wrong unless your body just doesn't take to it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good luck!
customer_reviews.text: While it's true that this doesn't mix well (i.e., it doesn't completely dissolve), I haven't found it to be a big deal since it's flavorless. I dump 5g (1 tsp) into a cup, fill it half-way with some water, swirl it around, and swig it. I did a loading phase, but it's not necessary. 5g/day every day will suffice. Performance-wise I have noticed slightly more energy at the end of my sets, but of course, as others say, it's hard to attribute solely to the creatine. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: though they naturally tend to get big pretty quick.
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. I had stopped lifting for months, probably more than 6 months. Wasn't taking care of myself at all. Got back into lifting, started taking this about a week before lifting. First week I was curling 60 on the preacher curl and struggling quite a bit. This week after working out other muscles all last week, this week I found myself curling 85 pounds. Granted it's easier to gain back muscle than it is to get it in the first place and I have been an on and off gym goer for years now. But that's huge progress, and I find my arms beefing up well, though they naturally tend to get big pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: M3nt0R

customer_reviews.title: Bad creatine does exist.
customer_reviews.text: This creatine is crystallized, as opposed to "powdery", and doesn't blend well. Causes some intestinal discomfort and bloating compared to other brands. I don't think we're allowed to recommend specific products in review of another, but creatine is cheap guys, it's worth an extra couple dollars for a better brand. Search for "ultra-pure micronized creatine."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for your buck|Unflavored greatness!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Arrived nicely packaged and sealed. Optimum Nutrition's creatine powder is the way to go! It's unflavored so you can power up your protein or pre-workout shakes without any weird tastes! Though I wouldn't recommend it, the easiest way to take it down is with a little water (very gritty), or throwing it in your mouth and washing with water. Tastes like filtered water. Make sure you stay hydrated while using this product. It's very important to drink ATLEAST 8 cups of water. Will be returning for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Yaser K

customer_reviews.title: This Creatine Sucks
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few different creatines and normally only feel some bloating or discomfort when I first start taking creatine from nothing. I've been on creatine for about 2 months and grabbed this brand just randomly since I didn't feel like driving to Walmart and grabbing one off the shelf there. This creatine makes my stomach hurt, comes with no scooper, and when you use a scooper it crystallizes really weirdly on the plastic. I've never seen a creatine do this and I've never had a creatine make me nauseated. I do not recommend this creatine at all!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work. Better Cheaper Alternative
customer_reviews.text: Hey, The people who are claiming this works are paid reviewers or its just a placebo effect of taking a new suppplement. I'm 6'3 260 pounds 14% Body Fat. Been doing body building/power lifting for the past 8 years straight. Whether Im taking this or not, there is no difference in my strength or gains. Ive been using it for the past 4 months and can say it doesnt work. I've tried a bunch of creatine supplements and this is by far the most ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: Blackcuts

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE READ! MAJOR WARNING
customer_reviews.text: This is counterfeit!! DO NOT BUY. The packaging is different and I had to go to the ER with dehydration and a kidney issue. If you look at the Optimum Nutrition website the branding is a different color. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Mix It With Everything
customer_reviews.text: So many creatine products to choose from, but the main thing I look for is that the creatine was NOT made in China. When it comes to a product that's relatively cheap to begin with, I'm not going to try to save a couple of dollars over the course of 120 servings and not know exactly what's in the creatine. I've had no issues with these and as long as they currently use Creapure and made in Germany, I'm happy to continue using it. There's no flavor to it, especially when I mix it in with my smoothies or mix it with my cottage cheese/yogurt.
customer_reviews.author: Kien

customer_reviews.title: good value, small crystals, still leaves some at the bottom
customer_reviews.text: very hard to mix into a drink, but probably would be better in a shake or smoothie. If you just mix into water or juice, there is going to be a lot left on the bottom. Started giving to my teenage son a month or so ago and he is already saying he feels his legs are a lot stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii T

customer_reviews.title: No more creapure
customer_reviews.text: Buyer aware Optimum Nutrition no longer uses the trade marked 100% pure creapure creatine . I’ve used this for over 15 years and noticed they changed the package logos with a new look and no longer specifies creapure so I reached out directly and the response I got back it they now outsource from all over the world with different suppliers
customer_reviews.author: Cortney Preston

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive Labeling
customer_reviews.text: This product is packaged in the U.S.A. but is made internationally. I called Optimum Nutrition to inquire as to the country of origin and their customer service representative said that the country of origin is "Proprietary Information" I know that some Creatine is made in China and most brands label it honestly as a "Product of China". I feel that it's deceptive not to list the country of manufacture of their product and therefore I will not use Optimum Nutrition Creatine. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: gary haines

customer_reviews.title: Some Great Creatine
customer_reviews.text: So this stuff dissolves excellent, literally almost like benefiter, if you've ever used it. Basically it dissolves completely and clearly very quickly and with very little stirring or shaking needed. No residual crystals or anything floating around in either cold or hot liquid. It's also tasteless so no gross fruit punch type flavors. I don't know why I haven't been using this stuff for years, previously having used some of the nasty flavored stuff or even pills because of flavor or product being difficult to dissolve. Long story short, this stuff is incredibly affordable and a quality product. Would highly recommend for any athlete or just your regular Joe or Jane looking to get/stay in shape.
customer_reviews.author: The Tenneys

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best value supplement you can take. It is proven to work more than almost any other supplement out there. That said, this unflavored, Creatine Monohydrate is the way to go. There are many other types of creatine out there but Monohydrate is the most effective. I usually mix it with one of my protein shakes. Just be sure you always drink plenty of water with it and throughout the day. I have found this gives me a very good pump after my workouts and I have slightly increased strength while using it as well.
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: Made me feel sick and warm. I could barely complete my workout. Never using any weird supplements again; they don't really regulate this stuff. I threw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Long

customer_reviews.title: 11/10 Would RECOMMEND* read on how to consume easily and effectively
customer_reviews.text: I’d recommend this 11/10! It’s amazing if you are serious in the gym. Of course it is not good for your kidneys if you do not consume enough water, so make sure you are always drinking enough water while on creatine. I’ve been taking this brand for years and have noticed changes from the start. Helps increase strength, water retention makes you gain size, win win. BEST WAY TO CONSUME- Just take a scoop directly in your mouth and drink it with a few sips of Gatorade. Don’t take it with just water or you’ll be wasting it as it won’t go directly into your blood stream without any sugar. Either Gatorade or cranberry juice is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AMZ Review

customer_reviews.title: I cannot believe its actually working...im getting yoked again...
customer_reviews.text: i was a very active weight lifter in my early 20's bodybuilding was a lifestyle. I got hurt real bad and turned away from all training. I am now 32 and have the urge to morph back into what i was. This Creatine simply works, i have never taken creatine before, but it has given me a boost in power i havent seen since i was 24. I dont know if its muscle memory from my past body, but this stuff is bringing me back FAST. It has made recovery and my muscles much firmer....im barely done with the loading stage and i feel like its giving me gains that would normally take months....
customer_reviews.author: southbaylsx

customer_reviews.title: Even Micronized is Gritty Like Sand
customer_reviews.text: Truly flavorless. But I expected the micronized grain to be finer. It's not even close to a powder, it's more like fine sand. They recommend you dissolve it in a cup of water, but it doesn't dissolve very quickly. I find the best way to take it is to use a teaspoon to scoop it out, dump it directly into my mouth, then take a sip of water to swallow all of it at the same time. I've never gotten dehydrated from taking creatine, even when I was loading up, taking it 3 times per day for a week, but you should be conscious that creatine in general makes some people dehydrated.
customer_reviews.author: White Star

customer_reviews.title: No longer contains Creapure
customer_reviews.text: The label changed which clearly shows that Creapure is no longer used. Creapure is produced in Germany and is considered the best manufacturer of the product. The source country is not listed on the packaging so this could come from anywhere (e.g., China) where monitoring/manufacturing/food safety may not be at the same level as Germany/Creapure.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT contain Creapure anymore. Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.text: Updated 12-6-19 Optimum Nutrition decided to cheap out, and this product is NOT made with Creapure creatine anymore. Creapure is produced by AlzChem Trostberg GmbH in Germany, and is the ONLY creatine source that can be trusted. Hey Optimum Nutrition, did you think we wouldn't notice? Just another supplement company making a shady ingredient swap once their product builds a following. Best to source from a more reputable supplier now. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Highly rated and trusted manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Great Creatine product! Did a lot of research prior to buying. If you feel you need to add this to your diet, this is a great choice. I use it for strength training and only take it after my workouts. Company has a great reputation for quality products. I believe diet is most important, but if you decide to add a supplement, this is a great product. Do your homework first...read all you can about supplements before spending the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product just not very convenient
customer_reviews.text: This product basically acts the same as any other brand of creatine but the main difference I would say is in the container. It is extremely inconvenient due to the fact that as far as I can tell it doesn't come with its own scoop, at least as far as I can tell, and the lid is extremely small it's difficult getting the right amount of creatine out. But other than that it's the same as any other source of creatine and for 15 dollars you get a good amount of it.
customer_reviews.author: Madskillz

customer_reviews.title: Large Servings, Low Price
customer_reviews.text: Overall the quality of the product seems to be there. The price is great for the amount of servings. My only legitimate complaint is that the scoop hole is small. I’d imagine that once you get to the bottom of the container, it’d be hard to get a scoop. But before you buy, just know that creatine draws water to your muscles. Your going to need to drink more water than usual.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Go with pills!
customer_reviews.text: I was choosing to but this creatine or the one in pills. I made a bad decision. It mixes with water really bad. I was doing one serving for bottle of water and always had something left on the bottom of bottle. I took it maybe 4 times and ordered pills. You don’t feel awful taste and don’t have to try mix and drink at the same time anymore. No complaints about ON but this creatine in powder is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Igor

customer_reviews.title: It is pretty gritty and doesn't dissolve easily
customer_reviews.text: Idk if it's a placebo effect or not, but I do notice that I get a second rush can push out an extra rep or two at the end of my sets. It is pretty gritty and doesn't dissolve easily, so what I do is scoop it into a shot glass with water, then shoot it down. You'll have to refill the shot glass with water a couple times to get it all, but works for me!
customer_reviews.author: andrew chang

customer_reviews.title: Already felt the difference
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give creatine a try. I’m on the loading phase now. I started on Saturday after I received it. Today it’s the day 3 that I’ve been taken it. I followed the instructions. 4 times a day during load phase and I already got couple new PRs. I felt my muscle recovers faster in between my workout sets. I felt more energy coming out from my muscle when I tried to push really hard. So far I like it even though the price is higher but it’s the product for my body. I prefer high standard and guaranteed quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shen

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff, horrible bottle
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good stuff and is probably one of the best creatines out there for the price. It seems to mix really well and I don't notice a difference in the taste compared to just a normal protein shake. I hate the bottle design though and that it doesn't come with its own scooper. Pretty much every supplement I purchase comes with its own scooper, so why can't this? And the bottle design is pretty dang bad. Super small opening so when you get to end of the bottle, it is extremely difficult to get anything out with a teaspoon.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the product for about 6 weeks. I have never been into body building, but I started going through hip and back issues as a result of injuries from younger years. I began a kettle bell and mace flow workout to help build my core and balance back up, and decided to throw in some creatine to aid in building the muscle back up. Boy was I surprised. I definitely have put on weight, and it definitely is mostly muscle. I just throw a teaspoon in a smoothie or some coffee in the morning, and do my thing. I will continue to use this as I am seeing good results.
customer_reviews.author: DCF

customer_reviews.title: creatine and creatine, but from trusted brand
customer_reviews.text: Ive always use either this brand or another depending on which is on sale. To be honest creatine is creatine, I dont think theres different formulation or anything. But Ive used ON stuff in the past and they just bring quality to the table and I trust the brand.
customer_reviews.author: ttsai

customer_reviews.title: Can upset stomach
customer_reviews.text: From what I've read, creatine is effective, not snake oil. I am taking a half tsp with my pre workout drink, and a half after with my Bcaa. Taking the 3 drinks seems to help, not running a scientific study. This doesn't affect the taste. Only problem was when I first started drinking it, I used a full spoonful. It made my stomach feel weird, like it was nervous or full of energy, really weird. I cut back to a half spoonful and it is much less noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Fan

customer_reviews.title: Flavorless, though difficult to mix in cold water
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I feel like it has helped my workouts and appearance of muscles. It is truly flavorless but it is difficult to dissolve (as with all creatine products). At first I mixed with shakes, but the grittiness and constant need to remix the shake became annoying. I then switched to mixing it in caffeine free coffee or tea, which completely dissolves it and you can't taste it. I've read that caffeine can diminish creatine's effectiveness, so stick with hot caffeine free mixers, and you should be good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only been lifting for about two years. Took some time off around the holidays to nurse an injury, and have been back at it during quarantine, but with consistent post-workout creatine daily. I’ve made more strength progress in two months with just body weight and 15 pound dumbbells (shoutout to Ryan Humiston’s youtube channel and his “light weight” workouts) than I made in over a year and a half in the gym. I have a much better understanding of muscle building now than I did two years ago, but the difference with this supplement is easily noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Almost a perfect product.
customer_reviews.text: Flavorless. Most flavored creatine makes me want to vomit. I would say this is around 95% Flavorless. It doesn't corrupt other fluids that I may mix it with. Not sure where the comment about chalky flavor came from, from another reviewer. Tricky to dissolve in ice cold water. But if you can't chug 8-12oz of cold water than you're too weak to work out. The bottle is garbage. The lid is a bit small to fit a spoon in without being a pain. I repackaged it in an extra Tupperware container. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: douglas s.

customer_reviews.title: Lid too small
customer_reviews.text: The packaging for this item is wack. I don't know who designed this head to be so small and the fact that it doesn't come with a scooper is ridiculous. I need to get a teaspoon every time... I use a tablespoon at the end. I'd recommend a different brand that has a normal size cap that doesn't spill and comes with a scooper. I give this three stars because it gets the job done and the creatine is legit.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Pour

customer_reviews.title: Great use for the pre-workout energy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the purpose of having a kick-start engine before the workout. It works fine, but it seems like it also has a laxative effect to certain extent. I only use 5 g per day, but my digestive system is not too welcoming this in my body. Nevertheless, it's a great cutting regiment tool for anyone who are looking for pre-workout non-stimulant!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work ok. Does not dissolve completely in cold water or liquid leaves a sandy substance in bottom of glass that you need to chew to finish the last gulp. Its great if you like to chew your drink. I sometimes put it in Coffee and it completely dissolves but makesy coffee tast not so great I believe creatin is basically a commodity. This product is made in USA and by a reputable company. It was highly recommended on other reviews so i tried it. I believe it has helped. I gain 3# of lean mass in 1 month, not lifting that heavy or consistent. My results were messured at doctors office on a electronic scale.
customer_reviews.author: David DeFazio

customer_reviews.title: Premature balding
customer_reviews.text: Took this years ago but recently looked over an old purchase. Made me start balding prematurely and still haven't fully recovered from the damage. It does work for increasing pumps and lifts, but it also bloats and skyrockets DHT. Went from a juvenile hairline to norwood 3 back down to norwood 2 after years. Stay AWAY from this.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Real deal insane pumps and gains.
customer_reviews.text: Creatine, the #1 supplement when wanting to get that pump in the gym and fill your muscles up. Taking this stuff daily helps with increased water and blow flow to muscles to really make a drastic change when working out and eating right every day. Its not a miracle powder but when used with the right exercises and right diet is does what its supposed to. I will never work out without having this creatine built up in my system. This was the cheapest I could find online with amazing results that cant be beat.
customer_reviews.author: kenny Roland pollich

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t dissolve well & no scoop
customer_reviews.text: I have problem dissolving it in the water. Seem like it’s grainy sandy at the bottom of the glass no matter how hard I stir it. Some people said that Creative won’t dissolve in the water by its nature. But I don’t see any clarification from the manufacturer. The concern is if it’s safe to drink it with the indissoluble creatine .... I had other brand that Creatine is more like powder and it dissolves completely with any liquid. Also, it will be nice if it comes with a serving scoop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Does what it is advertised to do
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Does what it is advertised to do. However, I noticed that my liver enzymes were all really high after using this product. I do not drink alcohol very often at all (Maybe one drink per month). I suspect this to be the culprit. This being said, I still use it everyday. Be sure to do your research on supplements. This one does not have many studies done on long term health effects.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The reviewer, “success is here” left a very dumb review in which he gave 1 star because his “doctor” said synthetic creating is harmful. Buddy, get yourself a new doctor and read a book for me one time. Creating is the most reviewed supplement out there and you’d be hard pressed to find a person with a brain who agrees with your “fitness enthusiast” “doctor”. Get yourself a real doc, bud
customer_reviews.author: Abcdef

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I got one that arrived with a broken seal, but the next one I got was just fine. Both were well before the expiration date. My only gripe is that the bottle neck is pretty tight for a man's hand, so you might need a pretty long teaspoon to get proper portions out of a nearly tapped bottle without dumping it into a new container.
customer_reviews.author: SA7

customer_reviews.title: Just received. Review based on initial use.
customer_reviews.text: Easily dissolved in warm water, so I recommend doing that first and then blending that into whatever drink you want to add it to. There's supposedly no taste to it, but I added it to some hot tea that I already was drinking and it definitely altered the taste in a not-so-good way. I will update after I try it in a protein smoothie and after some time passes to determine effectiveness. Disappointing that they don't provide a scoop.
customer_reviews.author: T.Barker

customer_reviews.title: Just good Points
customer_reviews.text: In this review I will just highlight the few weaknesses of this product that pleased me a lot, first the question of mixing, which is a little difficult, according to this is missing a measure and this is very important, as I leave in my bag I do not always have a precision balance to measure exactly, and third feels a bit like swallowing sand, I think due to the difficulty of mixing
customer_reviews.author: Cesar

customer_reviews.title: Low quality creatine. I wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Least water soluble creatine I have ever seen. You can shake it for 10 minutes in a shaker cup and still just have "sand" in the bottom the second you stop shaking. Indicating not only an incredibly low absorption rate inside the body but also just a cheap product. Mine is already in the trash. I would love a refund but doubt I'll get one.
customer_reviews.author: Arron

customer_reviews.title: Started getting headaches 😭
customer_reviews.text: So this never worked for me at least I never got far enough to tell the effects as I started getting headaches about day 2 into doing the loading phase... and this headache lasted about 3-4 days ☹ But I gave it to my trainer and boy he loves it 😄 anyways I think it should be added to the list of side effects. Ordered their GOLD STANDARD Pre Workout with Creatine, Beta-Alanine, and Caffeine for Energy, Keto Friendly, Green Apple flavour to try we'll see if that'll work🤷‍♀️ something's are just not for everyone. I'm giving them 4 stars based on my trainers use and review
customer_reviews.author: Islander1018

customer_reviews.title: Good product, terrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine. Mixes well, is tasteless and works as creatine should. My issue is with the bottle. For one, it doesn't come with a scoop. Secondly, it's a tall bottle with a very small opening. Scoops aren't tall enough to reach product and spoons are too thick to fit through the opening. Had to empty into a Ziploc bag.
customer_reviews.author: Keebler

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t dissolve well
customer_reviews.text: This product does not dissolve well. I mix it with juice, and it falls almost immediately to the bottom of my mixer cup, not matter how much I shake it. I do get to ingest some creatine if I shake between each sip though -lol. It leaves me with a bit of crunchy powder after drinking it as well. This is my second time purchasing the product, and I don’t recall having this issue the first time a year ago. However, I used to add it to my protein shake.
customer_reviews.author: JTinATL

customer_reviews.title: If only I knew about Creatine sooner.
customer_reviews.text: I've never been a supplement consumer and have gone through my athletic life ignoring best practice when it comes to nutritional supplements. What I've come to learn is that if you want to promote fast recovery and move yourself to a new level in fitness and overall health, Creatine is by far the best supplement you can add to your regime. I feel the difference in my recovery times and have been able to push through to a new level of training. After reading all of the research on Creatine I am convinced this is a must add to any serious athlete trying to push themselves to new limits.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: It worked! My muscles were definitely water  balloons in no time.
customer_reviews.text: The product seal beneath the lid was busted upon arrival. I probably shouldn't have used it... hmm... But anyway, it certainly had an effect and quickly. It was very embarrassing having bigger muscles all of the sudden and them literally having the consistency of water balloons. I don't think this product is worth the health risks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Vance

customer_reviews.title: Very clean
customer_reviews.text: Easy product to use. Fine crystals that don’t melt, at least in anything cold or at room temp. Haven’t tried it in anything hot, but that’s not an issue for me. It has no flavor and I mix in with protein drinks, cereal, even yogurt. I like the product and have reordered it. Definitely feel some additional pump during and after workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Buck A

customer_reviews.title: One of the most scientifically studied supplements proven to give you gains with no harmful side effects. Can't beat that.
customer_reviews.text: Don't be a barbarian, mix it with your protein powder for a boosted shake. I experienced a bit more water weight being retained, and some bloating once in awhile, especially when taking larger amounts, but no harmful side effects as some may believe. Did help with my power output for workouts!
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Good high quality creatine
customer_reviews.text: This stuff gives you the energy you need and helps you do that last rep you think you can't do. You'll only start noticing its effects though after using for a good bit since your muscles need to get saturated with it. Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing. I'm new to the muscle gaining scene and I've been doing my research on what supplements/powders will better help with my gains and body overall. Creatine is a must have and I'm so glad I purchased this. It cuts my soreness down in half and sometimes when I wake up after working out the day before I don't feel any soreness at all. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Kyra

customer_reviews.title: Good Ol Creatine
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's just good ol' creatine! Helps give me that last push when I workout. A must have if you're trying to avoid pre-workouts loaded with a salad bowl of different coloring and chemicals. It is kind of annoying how it doesn't come with its own measuring cup, though. If anything, find a creatine product that comes with its own serving spoon?
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kim

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: My brother recommended this to me and I have noticed a difference in my muscle mass and my over all energy level. I have used this for 2 weeks everyday with a mixture of milk, scoop of ice cream and some chocolate syrup or mixed with a fruity type drink.
customer_reviews.author: Bear James

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product for a week now, and I'm finally writing my personal review. First of all, this creatine isn't gritty it dissolves quickly and blends well in my shakes. Definitely recommend you try it for yourself, i will be ordering again once i finish this bottle. P.s. I'm not front loading this creatine and I'm still able to recover faster only after a week of use, also research creatine benefits online. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Vic Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Pure.  You get what you need.
customer_reviews.text: Creatine. Pure and simple. Why pay more? Look no further. This is all you need. Thirteen words to compliment this fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: NO MEASURING CUP IN CONTAINER
customer_reviews.text: As far as I can tell this creatine performs just like every other creatine I have purchase/used. The reason I am giving this product 2 stars is the fact that the company is to cheap to include a measuring spoon in the container. I have NEVER seen a workout supplement that didn't include a plastic measuring spoon/cup inside the container! This must be the cheapest company on the market.... WHO THE HELL CARRIES A TEASPOON IN THEIR GYM BAG FOR TAKING THEIR SUPPLEMENTS?!?!?!?!? AN ABSOLUTE JOKE OF A WAY TO SAVE A COUPLE OF CENTS!!!!! DO NOT BUY, UNLESS YOU WANT TO CARRY A METAL SPOON IN YOUR GYM BAG!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: benchpress was poor and I just couldn't find the fire to press ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried others to compare, so theres that. This might be more a review of creatine's benefits in general vs. non usage, but this product brand did the job. When I started using this I had very fast gains in strength and size. I was rehabbing from shoulder injury and progress was slow, benchpress was poor and I just couldn't find the fire to press more. Thought age was catching up. But after taking this, within 6 weeks I had almost doubled my 8 rep max. Anecdotal on my part but the bulk of research convinced me that this was safe and effective, and effective it was, for me.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon Miles

customer_reviews.title: Pump it up
customer_reviews.text: Optimum Nutrition Micronized Creatine Monohydrate Powder is a high-quality product. If you are serious about the gym, you know it's important to use high-quality monohydrate creatine. I am seeing excellent results in just the first few weeks. This should be your go-to powder.
customer_reviews.author: David Costa

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't mixed well yet
customer_reviews.text: I just started taking creatine, so I don't have much to say about it, however, this stuff says it's easily mixed with water and really any liquids, but I have yet to have it mix into anything I've put it in so far. So far it basically swirls around then falls harmlessly to the bottom. And a portion just sticks to the side of whatever I'm drinking out of. Crazy disappointing but that's it so far. Thankful that it's flavorless because drinking the mouthful that fell to the bottom all at once would have an impossible flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No longer using Creapure supplier
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered this product again and noticed it had an unpleasant taste this time (whereas before it had almost no taste). Checking the label, they no longer list CreaPure as the source. I assume the unpleasant taste was caused by impurities in the creatine. I'm switching to a brand that still uses Creapure.
customer_reviews.author: T C

customer_reviews.title: Works you just have to heat the water up and stir it
customer_reviews.text: The flavour itself tastes very chemically and doesn't mix well. Fix a cup with water and heat it up in your microwave. If the water is hot, the creatine will dissolve and you won't be left with that nasty chemical taste. The product does work, however.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Gives you the strength you've been looking for
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, gave me the extra energy I have been needing. Have been eating correctly and training and felt like I should be stronger and recovering faster. Well this filled that void and now I'm set. if you're the type of person that procrastinates and misses workouts because you're not that motivated you should do the loading phase with this creatine. it will allow you to see results faster so you can actually stick to your program and be consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Paul S.

customer_reviews.title: It's plain creatine
customer_reviews.text: It's unflavored creatine. It'll never fully dissolve and the taste is the taste. It works like any other creatine, take 5g a day. It's not steroids, improvements and benefits are minor but proven. If you're losing weight you may not appreciate the slight initial water weight increase. If you're worried about DHT and hair loss anecdotes, research it a bit before buying. Stir and chug.
customer_reviews.author: yeahh

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad Taste
customer_reviews.text: I just mix it with 2 scoops of my chocolate protein powder and I can't taste the difference. Haven't noticed any specific effects, but I hope it's working. The price is pretty good, but I wish that they had included a tiny spoon; the small opening at the top sometimes makes me spill a little with a spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gained more muscle from just regular workouts and taking this right after, a little less water soluble than I’d hoped but it doesn’t taste like anything so that’s great
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent creatine, doesn't mess with your stomach
customer_reviews.text: I was one of the first adopters of creatine way back when but quit using it a few years back after trying several different brands because they all were messing with my stomach. Then I found out from my brother that there are 2 different formulas and this is made from the one using creapure that doesn't mess with your stomach. Within a week all my lifts increased by about the 10-15% I lost when I quit taking it, 40 time dropped a tenth, vertical jump went up 2 inches. Some people don't notice much from creatine but i was always one that got great gains from it. Good stuff, doesn't mess with my stomach at all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: The creatine is really working for me. I started adding it to our smoothies and I really can push my workout further and my muscles are definitely developing more. I will continue using the product. You Don't taste it.
customer_reviews.author: N. V.

customer_reviews.title: Tasteless and appears to works
customer_reviews.text: This product is tasteless. Can mix in with water, milk, or whatever and you wont know its included. I had never used a product like this before. I can tell a difference. I believe I am less sore after workouts and recover faster.
customer_reviews.author: Peanuts

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and can’t taste it when mixed with water flavoring like I always do. The only complaint is it doesn’t completely dissolve sometimes, so you get the gritty feel in your mouth when you drink.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy, but exactly what you need.
customer_reviews.text: I've always been wary of creatine. Back in the day, there was this idea that it would kill your liver and kidneys. However, there is literally nothing but positive things that can come of consuming this. Be responsible and hydrate properly, and you will be golden. I've noticed strength and muscle size gains, and I feel that is at least partially due to this product. It's tasteless and I just throw it in my after gym protein shake and drink it down. Nothing fancy, just exactly what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Ksa0008

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: No measuring utensil but other than that it's great. No taste at all. I tasted it on my finger first then mixed it with my BCAAs. Couldn't tell it was in there!
customer_reviews.author: Scroggins

customer_reviews.title: Great for recovery
customer_reviews.text: I usually add this with my protein shake after workouts, and being unflavored it never leaves a bad taste if mixed well. I found that it helps a lot with my recovery and I feel a lot less sore after heavy lifting days. You only need 5g of it a day so it's easy to take in. There was a week where I was worked out without it (ran out and had to reorder), and I could definitely feel the difference. My muscles were a lot more sore days after heavy workouts and I felt I needed an extra rest day in between workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Gains on gains
customer_reviews.text: Great product, helped me do better in the gym and feel better overall. A spoon with some orange juice every morning before the gym greatly increased gains. After three months of use, started to see some crazy results. Best affordable and effective creative on the market, and it’s from a great trusted brand. Would recommend, especially if you have prime.
customer_reviews.author: Shivam Patel

customer_reviews.title: Simply a great creatine
customer_reviews.text: As many of you probably know, you can greatly overpay for creatine. The truth is creatine in the monohydrate powder form is as effective as any on the market. Why waste your hard earned dollars for slick packaging? I love this product for the value and consistency of quality from a reputable company. This review is from a non-compensated customer that paid full price and will do again shortly.
customer_reviews.author: slick_rick

customer_reviews.title: Creatine Supplement Works
customer_reviews.text: Taken as directed (starting with “loading” about 4x per day for 4-5 days, then one tsp per day) I found it to be a helpful supplement. Gains in muscle match were visible on the scale within three days. Overall, with careful nutrition, and HIIT training, this supplement gives a boost to better physique. Company delivered as ordered within good time frame.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Brad Scott

customer_reviews.title: Why did this arrive to me opened?
customer_reviews.text: I received this item, ripped the plastic off the top lid, then removed the lid to find the seal was 90% missing. Just a piece of it remains. The rest of the seal was not even within the container....
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Korngold

customer_reviews.title: Safety seal broke
customer_reviews.text: When I got my bottle today I noticed the product was off. The cap already seemed to be broken thought the plastic was still on the outside and the sealer on the bottle itself to get to the powder was opened. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy. Nothing to lose!
customer_reviews.text: Top rated micronized creatine on bodybuilding.com and I am in agreement. The product is so inexpensive and easy to take with huge strength boosts. I feel like it boosted my energy significantly. I began with a loading phrase about 4 servings per day then the following week went down to 5g per day because of my gold standard whey has some creatine anyways. You need to drink a lot of water with this product to see gains quicker. Micronizedd creatine doesn't upset my stomach like the standard mono hydrate does.
customer_reviews.author: kyle kelley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for what it is: a powder
customer_reviews.text: This powder has absolutely no taste and won't interfere with the flavor of your drink (e.g. your whey protein). But it is a powder, and you will be able to feel a bit of the texture of the tiny little grains in the liquid. There is nothing wrong with this product, but next time I'm going for the capsules.
customer_reviews.author: Fabrício

customer_reviews.title: Sealed and as described!
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with simple creatine monohydrate. As opposed to the common recommendation of 3-5g/day as a maintenance dose, Dr. Darren Candow (the leading creatine researcher) recommends 0.1g/kg of body weight.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work. Be near the rest room.
customer_reviews.text: my teenager is trying to gain weight for baseball. This has helped when I add it to his protein shakes. Problem is it makes him poop. The 20g "load" week was rough and we dropped him back to the recommended 5g. If you'll be near the rest room, this will help with weight gain and muscle recovery.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Okerholm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I can feel it working (tingling in my face and forearms) within 15 minutes. I’ve been using this product for over a year. No issues. Fast shipping.I take this twice a day. In the morning with water only, and in the evening mixed with other supplements. This one really has no flavor or texture to speak of and is fine in a little water. As for the does it work factor? Beats me. Something I take does... Maybe everything together? Either way, I’m not changing it!
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Found what I'm assuming is a bug. Threw bottle away.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this due to all the great reviews, but upon opening it I looked inside and found what I'm assuming is a dead bug or something. I threw the entire bottle away because I dont want to risk drinking something that would get me sick.
customer_reviews.author: Miscopy

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I have more energy to do those types of ...
customer_reviews.text: This really helps my lifts. I was able to gain the most muscle mass while I was drinking water with creatine daily. I got lazy and stopped and my gains and lifts suffered. Now that I'm back on it, I can feel my body be able to take heavier lifts, more reps. I feel like I have more energy to do those types of things as well.
customer_reviews.author: sally

customer_reviews.title: Low quality... spend the extra cash to get a better product
customer_reviews.text: I switch brands from 1st phorm to optimum because I figured a supplement that isn’t a blend would be the same. What could another company change? I was very wrong. Micronized creatine is supposed to dissolve better in water and if you are drinking it, it stays suspended in the drink for a few minutes before settling. This creatine does not. It sticks to the side of the bottle. Also, the creatine forms little “rocks” in the container. That is a sign of bad quality. The last brand I had was more of a flour-like consistency. Don’t waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Works for me.. I’ve noticed there’s a lot of bad reviews on this product. Mine didn’t come with a scoop either. Luckily I had a spare. I mix mine up with my bulk1340 to give it some flavor. If you take it by itself it does have a bland taste to it. Overall it’s a great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Marley

customer_reviews.title: Take this, get jacked
customer_reviews.text: So I just started lifting again after a couple years hiatus (kids...what you gonna do). Anyways, no joke, this coupled with some ON whey I’ve gained 20lbs in a few months and my muscle definition exploded. I had never really taken creatine before because I thought it upset my stomach, in reality it was gallstones, but I digress. So glad I decided to try it out again, my wife was like holy **** after just two months of lifting again. This stuff straight works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Creatine on The Market
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried other creatine products, including HCL Creatine. Hated the taste. This one literally has NO taste to it. I can mix it with plain water and not notice it. This also does the job well... I get a pretty decent pump going when I work out with this.
customer_reviews.author: Neal C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in its Simplicity
customer_reviews.text: A great creatine powder. That's the best part about this product, that's all it is. It's flavorless, and mixes in very well with both my preworkout and protein. It does not come with a scoop, and uses teaspoon measurements for serving size. (I saved a scoop from an old pre-workout, and it works just fine) Have not noticed any major difference between this brand and major leading brands. I'm a convert, as the cost is just too good.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Galvin

customer_reviews.title: No, creatine will not damage your liver. This has 4.5 stars for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know what pseudo- doctor the top 1 star reviewer goes to, but supplementing creatine will not damage your kidneys, liver, heart, etc.. I’ve heavily researched creatine to see whether I should add it into my fitness and I don’t regret it all— it’s the most researched supplement on the market, after all. It took me ~2 weeks for it to be synthesized into my muscles, and boy was it noticeable. My bench has been exploding and I recover considerably faster.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this. He mixes into his water with crystal light and he cannot taste this in there! It gives him a great boost of energy. He doesn’t go a single day without it! He highly recommends!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Creatine powder
customer_reviews.text: After lot of research, I decided to try this creatine powder. As per the description it says you need to consumed 5g per day, but if you’re a beginner it’s not necessary but you have to enter the loading phase by having 20g each day for the beginning 7 days and then you’ll have to consume 5g per day. I tried this i can this works, also this powder doesn’t have any flavor, you can easily have with your protein powder or water.
customer_reviews.author: Abhikant N

customer_reviews.title: Small neck for the bottle
customer_reviews.text: I love ON products. But...you guys seriously need some product development...the neck of the bottle is so small...a huge pain in the neck to scoop something out...I am switching back to muscle tech...
customer_reviews.author: realityreviews

customer_reviews.title: Does what is expected
customer_reviews.text: Have been using for about a week and already see a leaner tone. Friend told me she saw a difference and I didn’t even tell her, she didn’t even know what it was once I did lol. Only thing I would say is I wish it came with a serving scoop so for that I give it four stars
customer_reviews.author: Nick

product_meta.title: Optimum Nutrition Micronized Creatine Monohydrate Powder, Unflavored, Keto Friendly, 120 Servings (Packaging May Vary)
product_meta.description: Size:1.32 Pound (Pack of 1)Optimum nutrition creatine powder is unflavored.
feature_bullets: 5 grams pure creatine monohydrate per serving
Supports increases in energy, endurance & recovery
Maximum potency supports muscle size, strength, and power
Supreme absorbency micronized to get the most out of each dose
Unflavored can be mixed in your favorite beverage with ease- Product does not come with a scoop

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
